    »

    1. You are making a pitch to management to move your company’s IT resources to the cloud. Which of the following arguments is NOT one that you would use to make your case?

      We incur no up-front costs for deploying resources to the cloud, and we pay only for the resources that we use.

      Moving to the cloud will make it easier for us to scale our Web site as our customer base grows.

      If we choose one vendor’s cloud platform and later change our mind, it is easy to move virtual machines and other resources from one cloud platform to another.

      Cloud computing makes us more agile. We can deploy virtual machines in minutes, whereas procuring a physical server and installing it on-premises can take weeks or months.
